reviews.text: Returning to a hotel or Guest House suggests that you enjoyed you first stay, and from Jackie & Martin's guest book its clear that for many people theres only one place to book when you visit Bath. We were back for a second look after a whistle stop view last summer, and whilst we love the city and its attractions, its a couple of nights at Priory Cottage that made the visit special.
reviews.title: Great to go back

reviews.text: My wife, 4 month old baby and I stayed at Priory for 2 nights. We had a fabulous time. Jackie and Martin couldn't do enough to help - from the spotless room through to the friendly hints, they become a part of your Bath experience. The Priory is 10 minutes drive from Bath, but you can get into Bath a different way every time, and the roads leading to and from the Priory are beautiful.
reviews.title: Fantastic choice, sensational city

likes.liked: — The room was lovely, the location stunning and we loved the serenity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were lovely, with home made croissants and jams a highlight. An open fire, lots of useful brochures and cable TV sweeten the deal. Also, they just loved our baby, which is always going to win us over! Rooms were great and modern and the cottage and setting stunning. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Practically perfect in every way... you'd be hard pressed to find better

reviews.text: From the minute we arrived we were made welcome by Jackie and Martin as they showed us around their lovely property. The house is beautiful inside and out and was suitably a great introduction to county life in the UK. Even the little lane that the B&B is on had me snapping away with the camera. Our double room was clean, spacious, comfortable and tastefully decorated, with a lovely view out onto the 6 acres of green pastures out back.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B

likes.liked: — The use of a lounge for relaxing.
